mainSequence.step: User sends a GET request to Fishtext API to generate text
Fishtext API returns the text on success
Text is displayed on the screen using JavaScript on HTML DOM
User presses a key on the keyboard
The character is displayed by Keybord to the HTML DOM
Character is received by JavaScript from DOM
JavaScript checks the length of all entered characters
JavaScript starts the timer if the length is less than 2
JavaScript records the current date if the length is 2 or more
JavaScript checks the time elapsed since the last time
JavaScript updates the typing speed accordingly
JavaScript checks the correctness of the entered character
JavaScript applies necessary CSS classes based on input correctness
User presses a key on the keyboard again
The last character is displayed on the screen
Character is received by JavaScript from DOM
JavaScript stops the timer for the attempt
JavaScript calculates total points earned in the game
JavaScript creates an object with game data
Game data is sent as a POST request to the server
Server retrieves the latest user id from the database
Server updates user data in the Users table
Server adds the game attempt data to the Attempts table
JavaScript sets the user interface status accordingly
Stats window is displayed on the HTML DOM
JavaScript prepares data arrays for the speed graph
JavaScript draws a speed diagram on the screen
Diagram is shown to the user for viewing
JavaScript stores the game data in the browser's localStorage
